1#ifndef UVW_PROCESS_INCLUDE_H
2#define UVW_PROCESS_INCLUDE_H
3
4
5#include <utility>
6#include <memory>
7#include <string>
8#include <vector>
9#include <uv.h>
10#include "handle.hpp"
11#include "stream.h"
12#include "util.h"
13#include "loop.h"
14
15
16namespace uvw {
17
18
19namespace details {
20
21
22enum class UVProcessFlags: std::underlying_type_t<uv_process_flags> {
23 SETUID = UV_PROCESS_SETUID,
24 SETGID = UV_PROCESS_SETGID,
25 WINDOWS_VERBATIM_ARGUMENTS = UV_PROCESS_WINDOWS_VERBATIM_ARGUMENTS,
26 DETACHED = UV_PROCESS_DETACHED,
27 WINDOWS_HIDE = UV_PROCESS_WINDOWS_HIDE,
28 WINDOWS_HIDE_CONSOLE = UV_PROCESS_WINDOWS_HIDE_CONSOLE,
29 WINDOWS_HIDE_GUI = UV_PROCESS_WINDOWS_HIDE_GUI
30};
31
32
33enum class UVStdIOFlags: std::underlying_type_t<uv_stdio_flags> {
34 IGNORE_STREAM = UV_IGNORE,
35 CREATE_PIPE = UV_CREATE_PIPE,
36 INHERIT_FD = UV_INHERIT_FD,
37 INHERIT_STREAM = UV_INHERIT_STREAM,
38 READABLE_PIPE = UV_READABLE_PIPE,
39 WRITABLE_PIPE = UV_WRITABLE_PIPE,
40 OVERLAPPED_PIPE = UV_OVERLAPPED_PIPE
41};
42
43
44}
45
46
47/**
48 * @brief ExitEvent event.
49 *
50 * It will be emitted by ProcessHandle according with its functionalities.
51 */
52struct ExitEvent {
53 explicit ExitEvent(int64_t code, int sig) noexcept;
54
55 int64_t status; /*!< The exit status. */
56 int signal; /*!< The signal that caused the process to terminate, if any. */
57};
58
59/**
60 * @brief The ProcessHandle handle.
61 *
62 * Process handles will spawn a new process and allow the user to control it and
63 * establish communication channels with it using streams.
64 */
65class ProcessHandle final: public Handle<ProcessHandle, uv_process_t> {
66 static void exitCallback(uv_process_t *handle, int64_t exitStatus, int termSignal);
67
68public:
69 using Process = details::UVProcessFlags;
70 using StdIO = details::UVStdIOFlags;
71
72 ProcessHandle(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref);
73
74 /**
75 * @brief Disables inheritance for file descriptors/handles.
76 *
77 * Disables inheritance for file descriptors/handles that this process
78 * inherited from its parent. The effect is that child processes spawned by
79 * this process don’t accidentally inherit these handles.<br/>
80 * It is recommended to call this function as early in your program as
81 * possible, before the inherited file descriptors can be closed or
82 * duplicated.
83 *
84 * See the official
85 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/process.html#c.uv_disable_stdio_inheritance)
86 * for further details.
87 */
88 static void disableStdIOInheritance() noexcept;
89
90 /**
91 * @brief kill Sends the specified signal to the given PID.
92 * @param pid A valid process id.
93 * @param signum A valid signal identifier.
94 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
95 */
96 static bool kill(int pid, int signum) noexcept;
97
98 /**
99 * @brief Initializes the handle.
100 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
101 */
102 bool init();
103
104 /**
105 * @brief spawn Starts the process.
106 *
107 * If the process isn't successfully spawned, an ErrorEvent event will be
108 * emitted by the handle.
109 *
110 * See the official
111 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/process.html)
112 * for further details.
113 *
114 * @param file Path pointing to the program to be executed.
115 * @param args Command line arguments.
116 * @param env Optional environment for the new process.
117 */
118 void spawn(const char *file, char **args, char **env = nullptr);
119
120 /**
121 * @brief Sends the specified signal to the internal process handle.
122 * @param signum A valid signal identifier.
123 */
124 void kill(int signum);
125
126 /**
127 * @brief Gets the PID of the spawned process.
128 *
129 * It’s set after calling `spawn()`.
130 *
131 * @return The PID of the spawned process.
132 */
133 int pid() noexcept;
134
135 /**
136 * @brief Sets the current working directory for the subprocess.
137 * @param path The working directory to be used when `spawn()` is invoked.
138 * @return A reference to this process handle.
139 */
140 ProcessHandle & cwd(std::string path) noexcept;
141
142 /**
143 * @brief Sets flags that control how `spawn()` behaves.
144 *
145 * Available flags are:
146 *
147 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::SETUID`
148 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::SETGID`
149 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::WINDOWS_VERBATIM_ARGUMENTS`
150 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::DETACHED`
151 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::WINDOWS_HIDE`
152 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::WINDOWS_HIDE_CONSOLE`
153 * * `ProcessHandle::Process::WINDOWS_HIDE_GUI`
154 *
155 * See the official
156 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/process.html#c.uv_process_flags)
157 * for further details.
158 *
159 * @param flags A valid set of flags.
160 * @return A reference to this process handle.
161 */
162 ProcessHandle & flags(Flags<Process> flags) noexcept;
163
164 /**
165 * @brief Makes a `stdio` handle available to the child process.
166 *
167 * Available flags are:
168 *
169 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::IGNORE_STREAM`
170 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::CREATE_PIPE`
171 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::INHERIT_FD`
172 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::INHERIT_STREAM`
173 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::READABLE_PIPE`
174 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::WRITABLE_PIPE`
175 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::OVERLAPPED_PIPE`
176 *
177 * See the official
178 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/process.html#c.uv_stdio_flags)
179 * for further details.
180 *
181 * @param stream A valid `stdio` handle.
182 * @param flags A valid set of flags.
183 * @return A reference to this process handle.
184 */
185 template<typename T, typename U>
186 ProcessHandle & stdio(StreamHandle<T, U> &stream, Flags<StdIO> flags) {
187 uv_stdio_container_t container;
188 Flags<StdIO>::Type fgs = flags;
189 container.flags = static_cast<uv_stdio_flags>(fgs);
190 container.data.stream = get<uv_stream_t>(stream);
191 poStreamStdio.push_back(std::move(container));
192 return *this;
193 }
194
195 /**
196 * @brief Makes a file descriptor available to the child process.
197 *
198 * Available flags are:
199 *
200 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::IGNORE_STREAM`
201 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::CREATE_PIPE`
202 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::INHERIT_FD`
203 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::INHERIT_STREAM`
204 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::READABLE_PIPE`
205 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::WRITABLE_PIPE`
206 * * `ProcessHandle::StdIO::OVERLAPPED_PIPE`
207 *
208 * Default file descriptors are:
209 * * `uvw::StdIN` for `stdin`
210 * * `uvw::StdOUT` for `stdout`
211 * * `uvw::StdERR` for `stderr`
212 *
213 * See the official
214 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/process.html#c.uv_stdio_flags)
215 * for further details.
216 *
217 * @param fd A valid file descriptor.
218 * @param flags A valid set of flags.
219 * @return A reference to this process handle.
220 */
221 ProcessHandle & stdio(FileHandle fd, Flags<StdIO> flags);
222
223 /**
224 * @brief Sets the child process' user id.
225 * @param id A valid user id to be used.
226 * @return A reference to this process handle.
227 */
228 ProcessHandle & uid(Uid id);
229
230 /**
231 * @brief Sets the child process' group id.
232 * @param id A valid group id to be used.
233 * @return A reference to this process handle.
234 */
235 ProcessHandle & gid(Gid id);
236
237private:
238 std::string poCwd;
239 Flags<Process> poFlags;
240 std::vector<uv_stdio_container_t> poFdStdio;
241 std::vector<uv_stdio_container_t> poStreamStdio;
242 Uid poUid;
243 Gid poGid;
244};
245
246
247}
248
249
250#ifndef UVW_AS_LIB
251#include "process.cpp"
252#endif
253
254#endif // UVW_PROCESS_INCLUDE_H
